thread.title: Lights, Cameras But Little Action for China’s New Film Capital

author: Wayne Ma
title: Lights, Cameras But Little Action for China’s New Film Capital
text:
QINGDAO—Billionaire Wang Jianlin boasted that this seaside city would one day rival Hollywood as a global film capital. But as Wanda Studios Qingdao marks its official opening Saturday, attaining that status seems even more remote than when Mr. Wang made his declaration five years ago.
Mr. Wang’s Dalian Wanda Group spent nearly $1 billion building 30 soundstages and state-of-the-art production facilities, people familiar with the matter say—all part of a vast, $8 billion Qingdao Movie Metropolis that also includes apartments,... RELATED VIDEO China Is the New Hollywood, Director Says Big-budget director Renny Harlin, known for films such as "Die Hard 2" and "Cliffhanger," has left Hollywood behind to work in China, the world's fastest-growing movie market.
